From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To suppress the display of password information in configuration log files, use the **hidekeys** command in configuration change logger configuration mode. To allow the display of password information in configuration log files, use the **no** form of this command.

ParaDef.Info: This commmand has no arguments or keywords.

Examples: The following example shows how to prevent password information from being displayed in configuration log files:
ExtraInfo: Enabling the **hidekeys** command increases security by preventing password information from being displayed in configuration log files.

RelatedCmds.description: Enters configuration change logger configuration mode.
Enables the logging of configuration changes.
Specifies the maximum number of entries retained in the configuration log.
Enables the sending of notifications of configuration changes to a remote syslog.
Displays entries from the configuration log.
